Police investigate armed robbery at fast food restaurant
Posted December 3, 2011 at 1:07 p.m.
Discuss Print A A A
San Angelo Police were investigating an armed robbery that occurred early Saturday morning at a local drive-through window.
Officers were called to Whataburger, in the 4600 block of Knickerbocker road, about 5:05 a.m. in reference to robbery that had just occurred.
An employee at the restaurant told responding Officer Bary Ratcliff that a dark colored SUV pulled up to the drive-through window when the passenger pointed a gun at the employee, according to a police news release.
The driver demanded that the employee gather all money from the restaurant, police said.
The driver and passenger were described as white men, one about 35 years old and one in his early 20s.
The employee turned over an undisclosed amount of money to the two suspects and they drove away, according to the release.
Officers searched the area, but were unable to find the suspect vehicle. Detective Chris Soto was assigned to the case.
It is still under investigation.
